greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation mapping from Lucky sieve to Ludic sieve: a(1) = 1, for n > 1: a(n) = A255127(A260438(n), A260439(n)).
comment: a(n) tells which number in array A255127 (constructed from Ludic sieve) is at the same position where n is in array A255551 (constructed from Lucky sieve). This permutation fixes all even numbers because both arrays have A005843 as their topmost row.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10104
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
formula: a(A000959(n+1)) = A003309(n+2). [Maps Lucky numbers to odd Ludic numbers.]
As a composition of related permutations:
program: (Scheme) (define (A260435 n) (if (<= n 1) n (A255127bi (A260438 n) (A260439 n)))) ;; Code for A255127bi given in A255127.
xref: Similar or related permutations: A255407, A255552, A255554, A249817, A249818, A260741 (a more recursed variant).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 30 2015
